<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 91]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 660, 92]]<|/det|> In this experiment, you will investigate the scale of a thermometer. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 650, 123]]<|/det|> Carry out the following instructions, referring to Figs. 2.1 and 2.2. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 134, 146, 153]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 727, 153]]<|/det|> Record the value of room temperature \(\theta_{\mathrm{R}}\) shown on the thermometer. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[544, 163, 878, 183]]<|/det|>
\(\theta_{\mathrm{R}} =\) .................................................... [1] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 196, 146, 214]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 195, 876, 229]]<|/det|> You are provided with a supply of hot water. Place the thermometer into the beaker of hot water, as shown in Fig. 2.1. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[319, 240, 680, 510]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 526, 532, 544]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 558, 144, 577]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 558, 180, 577]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 556, 875, 606]]<|/det|> When the thermometer reading stops rising, measure the temperature \(\theta\) of the water in the beaker and immediately start the stopclock. Record \(\theta\) in Table 2.1 at time \(t = 0s\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 619, 181, 637]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 618, 875, 653]]<|/det|> Record in the table the time \(t\) and the temperature \(\theta\) of the water every 30s until you have a total of seven readings. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 781, 92]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the position of the image in a plane mirror.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 571, 123]]<|/det|>
Carry out the following instructions referring to Fig. 4.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 128, 841, 823]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 835, 532, 855]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 4.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 808, 91]]<|/det|>
Draw a line 10.0cm long near the middle of the ray-trace sheet. Label the line MR

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 87, 828, 120]]<|/det|>
a normal to this line that passes through its centre. Label the normal NL. Label the line at which NL crosses MR with the letter B.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 134, 144, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 873, 167]]<|/det|>
Draw a line 8.0cm long from \(\mathbf{B}\) at an angle of incidence \(i = 30^{\circ}\) to the normal below MR and to the left of the normal. Label the end of this line \(\mathbf{A}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 180, 144, 199]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 180, 601, 199]]<|/det|>
Place a pin \(\mathsf{P}_1\) on line \(\mathbf{AB}\) at a distance 7.0cm from \(\mathbf{B}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 211, 146, 229]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 211, 601, 229]]<|/det|>
Place a pin \(\mathsf{P}_2\) on line \(\mathbf{AB}\) at a distance 1.0cm from \(\mathbf{B}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 242, 144, 260]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 242, 668, 260]]<|/det|>
Place the reflecting face of the mirror vertically on the line MR.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 273, 141, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>(f)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 273, 875, 322]]<|/det|>
View the images of pins \(\mathsf{P}_1\) and \(\mathsf{P}_2\) from the direction indicated by the eye in Fig. 4.1. Place two pins \(\mathsf{P}_3\) and \(\mathsf{P}_4\) some distance apart so that pins \(\mathsf{P}_3\) and \(\mathsf{P}_4\), and the images of \(\mathsf{P}_2\) and \(\mathsf{P}_1\), all appear exactly one behind the other. Label the positions of \(\mathsf{P}_3\) and \(\mathsf{P}_4\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 335, 146, 354]]<|/det|>
<label>(g)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 335, 875, 369]]<|/det|>
Remove the pins and the mirror and draw the line joining the positions of \(\mathsf{P}_3\) and \(\mathsf{P}_4\). Continue the line until it crosses MR and extends at least 8.0cm beyond MR.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 382, 146, 400]]<|/det|>
<label>(h)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 381, 856, 400]]<|/det|>
Replace pin \(\mathsf{P}_1\) on line \(\mathbf{AB}\) in the same position as in (c), at a distance 7.0cm from \(\mathbf{B}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 411, 141, 429]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 411, 640, 431]]<|/det|>
Place pin \(\mathsf{P}_2\) 1.0cm to the right of its position in part (d).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 443, 141, 462]]<|/det|>
<label>(j)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 443, 448, 462]]<|/det|>
Repeat the steps in parts (e) to (g).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 475, 144, 494]]<|/det|>
<label>(k)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 475, 670, 494]]<|/det|>
Label with a \(\mathbf{Y}\) the point where the two lines beyond MR cross.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 507, 141, 525]]<|/det|>
<label>(l)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 507, 186, 525]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 507, 875, 540]]<|/det|>
Draw a line from \(\mathsf{P}_1\) to MR that meets MR at a right angle. Measure and record the length \(a\) of this line.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[554, 553, 871, 571]]<|/det|>
\[a = \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \quad (1)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 584, 183, 602]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 584, 875, 617]]<|/det|>
Draw a line from the point labelled \(\mathbf{Y}\) to MR that meets MR at a right angle. Measure and record the length \(b\) of this line.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[554, 630, 871, 648]]<|/det|>
\[b = \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \dots \quad (2)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 676, 148, 694]]<|/det|>
<label>(m)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 676, 720, 694]]<|/det|>
A student suggests that the length \(a\) should be equal to the length \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 707, 875, 740]]<|/det|>
State whether your results support this suggestion. Justify your statement by reference to your results.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 860, 875, 878]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(n)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 811, 109]]<|/det|>
